message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the effects of direct sunlight on objects. When a large boulder is kept in direct sunlight, it can heat up and expand. Over time, this expansion can cause portions of the boulder to crack or break off, resulting in the boulder losing portions. Option (A) is incorrect because sunlight does not directly make the boulder more powerful. Option (B) is incorrect because a boulder does not grow larger through exposure to sunlight. Option (C) is incorrect because sunlight does not cause the boulder to gain chill.

This question requires basic understanding of the effects of sunlight on objects. When a large boulder is kept in direct sunlight, it can lose portions due to a process called weathering. Sunlight causes expansion and contraction of the boulder, leading to small cracks and fractures. Over time, these cracks can widen and portions of the boulder can break off, causing it to lose portions. Option (A) is incorrect because sunlight does not directly make the boulder more powerful. Option (B) is also incorrect because sunlight does not cause the boulder to grow larger. Option (C) is unrelated to sunlight's effect on the boulder.

This question requires knowledge about the effects of sunlight on objects. When a large boulder is kept in direct sunlight, it can undergo thermal expansion, which means it heats up and expands. Over time, this can cause the boulder to develop cracks and ultimately lose portions of itself. Option (A) and (B) are incorrect because the boulder does not gain power or grow larger. Option (C) is incorrect because direct sunlight would cause the boulder to heat up, not gain chill.

Option (A) is incorrect because sunlight does not give objects any type of power. Option (B) is incorrect because sunlight does not cause a boulder to grow larger.
